084import static org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.tool.JavadocTool.isValidClassName;

086/**
087 * This class manages elements specified on the command line, and
088 * produces "specified" and "included" data sets, needed by the
089 * doclet environment, as well as querying an elements' visibility
090 * or inclusion.
091 *
092 * A. Initialization phase: the class is initialized with the
093 *    options table by the caller. Some program elements may not
094 *    be specified via specific options, such as packages, classes,
095 *    these are set with the use of setter methods, such setClassArgList
096 *    and setClassDeclList.
097 *
098 * B. Scan and decode phase: this is performed by scanSpecifiedItems,
099 *    to identify the modules specified on the command line, modules
100 *    specified with qualified packages and qualified subpackages, the
101 *    modules so identified are used to initialize the module system.
102 *
103 * C. Intermediate phase: before the final analysis can be done,
104 *    intermediate methods can be used to get specified elements from
105 *    the initialization phase, typically used to parse sources or packages
106 *    specified on the command line.
107 *
108 * D. Analysis phase: the final analysis is performed to determine
109 *    the packages that ought to be included, as follows:
110 *
111 *    1. computes the specified modules, by considering the option
112 *       "expand-requires", this must be done exhaustively, as the package
113 *       computation phase expects a completed module graph, in order to
114 *       check the target of a qualified export is in the included set.
115 *
116 *    2. computes the packages that must be documented, by considering
117 *       the option "show-packages", also if only exported packages are
118 *       to be considered, then also check for qualified packages, and
119 *       include only those packages whose target is in the included set.
120 *
121 *    3. compute the specified packages, as part of this, first compute
122 *       the subpackages and exclude any packages, if required.
123 *
124 *    4. Finally, compute the types found by previous parsing steps,
125 *       noting that, all enclosed types (nested types) must also be
126 *       considered.
127 *
128 * E. Finally, this class provides methods to obtain the specified sets,
129 *    which are frozen and cached in the analysis phase, the included
130 *    sets, are computed lazily and cached for future use. An element
131 *    can be checked if it should be documented, in which case, the
132 *    element is checked against the included set and the result is
133 *    cached, for performance reasons.
134 *
135 * Definitions:
136 *    Fully included: an element is included and some or parts
137 *    of it components are included implicitly, subject to a
138 *    selection criteria of its enclosed children.
139 *
140 *    Included: if the item should be documented.
141 *
142 * Rules for processing:
143 *
144 * 1. A specified element, meaning an element given on the
145 *    command-line, and exposed via specified elements collections.
146 * 2. Expand-contents, an internal pseudo term, meaning
147 *    it is part of the recursive expansion of specified
148 *    elements, meaning, the modules are expanded first, then
149 *    the packages contained in the expanded modules, and then
150 *    the types contained within the packages, to produce the
151 *    collections returned by the methods
152 *    getInclude{Module|Package|Type}Elements(), this is a
153 *    downward expansion.
154 * 3. An included element, meaning it should be documented, and
155 *    exposed via isIncluded, this enclosing element (module, package)
156 *    is recursively included.
157 */
158public class ElementsTable {
159
160    private final ToolEnvironment toolEnv;
161    private final Symtab syms;
162    private final Names names;
163    private final JavaFileManager fm;
164    private final List<Location> locations;
165    private final Modules modules;
166    private final ToolOptions options;
167    private final JavadocLog log;
168    private final JavaCompiler compiler;
169
170    private final Map<String, Entry> entries = new LinkedHashMap<>();
171
172    // specified elements
173    private Set<ModuleElement> specifiedModuleElements = new LinkedHashSet<>();
174    private Set<PackageElement> specifiedPackageElements
175        = new LinkedHashSet<>();
176    private Set<TypeElement> specifiedTypeElements = new LinkedHashSet<>();
177
178    // included elements
179    private Set<ModuleElement> includedModuleElements = null;
180    private Set<PackageElement> includedPackageElements = null;
181    private Set<TypeElement> includedTypeElements = null;
182
183    // cmdline specifiers
184    private Set<ModulePackage> cmdLinePackages = new LinkedHashSet<>();
185    private Set<ModulePackage> excludePackages = new LinkedHashSet<>();
186    private Set<ModulePackage> subPackages = new LinkedHashSet<>();
187
188    private List<JCClassDecl> classDecList = List.of();
189    private List<String> classArgList = List.of();
190    private com.sun.tools.javac.util.List<JCCompilationUnit> classTreeList
191        = null;
192
193    private final Set<JavaFileObject.Kind> sourceKinds
194        = EnumSet.of(JavaFileObject.Kind.SOURCE);
195
196    private final ModifierFilter accessFilter;
197
198    private final AccessKind expandRequires;
199
200    final boolean xclasses;
201
202    /**
203     * Creates the table to manage included and excluded elements.
204     *
205     * @param context the context to locate commonly used objects
206     * @param options the tool options
207     */
208    ElementsTable(Context context, ToolOptions options) {
209        this.toolEnv = ToolEnvironment.instance(context);
210        this.syms = Symtab.instance(context);
211        this.names = Names.instance(context);
212        this.fm = toolEnv.fileManager;
213        this.modules = Modules.instance(context);
214        this.options = options;
215        this.log = JavadocLog.instance0(context);
216        this.compiler = JavaCompiler.instance(context);
217        Source source = Source.instance(context);
218
219        List<Location> locs = new ArrayList<>();
220        if (modules.multiModuleMode) {
221            locs.add(StandardLocation.MODULE_SOURCE_PATH);
222        } else {
223            if (toolEnv.fileManager.hasLocation(StandardLocation.SOURCE_PATH))
224                locs.add(StandardLocation.SOURCE_PATH);
225            else
226                locs.add(StandardLocation.CLASS_PATH);
227        }
228        if (Feature.MODULES.allowedInSource(source) && toolEnv.fileManager
229            .hasLocation(StandardLocation.PATCH_MODULE_PATH))
230            locs.add(StandardLocation.PATCH_MODULE_PATH);
231        this.locations = Collections.unmodifiableList(locs);
232
233        getEntry("").excluded = false;
234
235        accessFilter = new ModifierFilter(options);
236        xclasses = options.xclasses();
237        expandRequires = options.expandRequires();
238    }
239
240    /**
241     * Returns the module documentation level mode.
242     * @return the module documentation level mode
243     */
244    public ModuleMode getModuleMode() {
245        return switch (accessFilter.getAccessValue(ElementKind.MODULE)) {
246        case PACKAGE, PRIVATE -> ModuleMode.ALL;
247        default -> ModuleMode.API;
248        };
249    }
250
251    private Set<Element> specifiedElements = null;
252
253    /**
254     * Returns a set of elements specified on the
255     * command line, including any inner classes.
256     *
257     * @return the set of elements specified on the command line
258     */
259    public Set<? extends Element> getSpecifiedElements() {
260        if (specifiedElements == null) {
261            Set<Element> result = new LinkedHashSet<>();
262            result.addAll(specifiedModuleElements);
263            result.addAll(specifiedPackageElements);
264            result.addAll(specifiedTypeElements);
265            specifiedElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(result);
266        }
267        return specifiedElements;
268    }
269
270    private Set<Element> includedElements = null;
271
272    /**
273     * Returns a set of elements included elements. The inclusion is as
274     * follows:
275     * A module is fully included,
276     *   - is specified on the command line --module
277     *   - is derived from the module graph, that is, by expanding the
278     *     'requires' directive, based on --expand-requires
279     *
280     * A module is included if an enclosed package or type is
281     * specified on the command line.
282     *
283     * A package is fully included,
284     *  - is specified on the command line
285     *  - is derived from expanding -subpackages
286     *  - can be documented in a fully included module based on --show-packages
287     *
288     * A package is included, if an enclosed package or a type is specified on
289     * the command line.
290     *
291     * Included type elements (including those within specified or included packages)
292     * to be documented.
293     *
294     * A type is fully included if
295     *  - is specified on the command line with -sourcepath
296     *  - is visible with --show-types filter
297     * A nested type is fully included if
298     *  - is visible with --show-types filter
299     *  - is enclosed in a fully included type
300     * @return the set of elements specified on the command line
301     */
302    public Set<? extends Element> getIncludedElements() {
303        if (includedElements == null) {
304            Set<Element> result = new LinkedHashSet<>();
305            result.addAll(includedModuleElements);
306            result.addAll(includedPackageElements);
307            result.addAll(includedTypeElements);
308            includedElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(result);
309        }
310        return includedElements;
311    }
312
313    private IncludedVisitor includedVisitor = null;
314
315    /**
316     * Returns true if the given element is included for consideration.
317     * This method accumulates elements in the cache as enclosed elements of
318     * fully included elements are tested.
319     * A member (constructor, method, field) is included if
320     *  - it is visible in a fully included type (--show-members)
321     *
322     * @param e the element in question
323     *
324     * @see #getIncludedElements()
325     *
326     * @return true if included
327     */
328    public boolean isIncluded(Element e) {
329        if (e == null) {
330            return false;
331        }
332        if (includedVisitor == null) {
333            includedVisitor = new IncludedVisitor();
334        }
335        return includedVisitor.visit(e);
336    }
337
338    /**
339     * Performs the final computation and freezes the collections.
340     * This is a terminal operation, thus no further modifications
341     * are allowed to the specified data sets.
342     *
343     * @throws ToolException if an error occurs
344     */
345    void analyze() throws ToolException {
346        // compute the specified element, by expanding module dependencies
347        computeSpecifiedModules();
348
349        // compute all specified packages and subpackages
350        computeSpecifiedPackages();
351
352        // compute the specified types
353        computeSpecifiedTypes();
354
355        // compute the packages belonging to all the specified modules
356        Set<PackageElement> expandedModulePackages = computeModulePackages();
357        initializeIncludedSets(expandedModulePackages);
358    }
359
360    ElementsTable classTrees(
361            com.sun.tools.javac.util.List<JCCompilationUnit> classTrees) {
362        this.classTreeList = classTrees;
363        return this;
364    }
365
366    /*
367     * This method sanity checks the following cases:
368     * a. a source-path containing a single module and many modules specified
369     * with --module
370     * b. no modules on source-path
371     * c. mismatched source-path and many modules specified with --module
372     */
373    void sanityCheckSourcePathModules(List<String> moduleNames)
374            throws ToolException {
375        if (!haveSourceLocationWithModule)
376            return;
377
378        if (moduleNames.size() > 1) {
379            String text = log.getText("main.cannot_use_sourcepath_for_modules",
380                String.join(", ", moduleNames));
381            throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
382        }
383
384        String foundModule = getModuleName(StandardLocation.SOURCE_PATH);
385        if (foundModule == null) {
386            String text = log.getText("main.module_not_found_on_sourcepath",
387                moduleNames.get(0));
388            throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
389        }
390
391        if (!moduleNames.get(0).equals(foundModule)) {
392            String text = log.getText("main.sourcepath_does_not_contain_module",
393                moduleNames.get(0));
394            throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
395        }
396    }
397
398    private String getModuleName(Location location) throws ToolException {
399        try {
400            JavaFileObject jfo = fm.getJavaFileForInput(location,
401                "module-info", JavaFileObject.Kind.SOURCE);
402            if (jfo != null) {
403                JCCompilationUnit jcu = compiler.parse(jfo);
404                JCModuleDecl module = TreeInfo.getModule(jcu);
405                if (module != null) {
406                    return module.getName().toString();
407                }
408            }
409        } catch (IOException ioe) {
410            String text = log.getText("main.file.manager.list", location);
411            throw new ToolException(SYSERR, text, ioe);
412        }
413        return null;
414    }
415
416    ElementsTable scanSpecifiedItems() throws ToolException {
417
418        // scan modules specified on the command line
419        List<String> modules = options.modules();
420        List<String> mlist = new ArrayList<>();
421        for (String m : modules) {
422            List<Location> moduleLocations = getModuleLocation(locations, m);
423            if (moduleLocations.isEmpty()) {
424                String text = log.getText("main.module_not_found", m);
425                throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
426            }
427            if (moduleLocations.contains(StandardLocation.SOURCE_PATH)) {
428                sanityCheckSourcePathModules(modules);
429            }
430            mlist.add(m);
431            ModuleSymbol msym = syms.enterModule(names.fromString(m));
432            specifiedModuleElements.add(msym);
433        }
434
435        // scan for modules with qualified packages
436        cmdLinePackages.stream()
437            .filter(ModulePackage::hasModule)
438            .forEachOrdered(mpkg -> mlist.add(mpkg.moduleName));
439
440        // scan for modules with qualified subpackages
441        options.subpackages().stream()
442            .map(ModulePackage::new)
443            .forEachOrdered(mpkg -> {
444                subPackages.add(mpkg);
445                if (mpkg.hasModule()) {
446                    mlist.add(mpkg.moduleName);
447                }
448            });
449
450        // all the modules specified on the command line have been scraped
451        // init the module systems
452        this.modules
453            .addExtraAddModules(mlist.toArray(new String[mlist.size()]));
454        this.modules.initModules(this.classTreeList);
455
456        return this;
457    }
458
459    /**
460     * Returns the includes table after setting a class names specified on the command line.
461     *
462     * @param classList
463     * @return the include table
464     */
465    ElementsTable setClassArgList(List<String> classList) {
466        classArgList = classList;
467        return this;
468    }
469
470    /**
471     * Returns the includes table after setting the parsed class names.
472     *
473     * @param classesDecList
474     * @return the include table
475     */
476    ElementsTable setClassDeclList(List<JCClassDecl> classesDecList) {
477        this.classDecList = classesDecList;
478        return this;
479    }
480
481    /**
482     * Returns an includes table after setting the specified package
483     * names.
484     * @param packageNames packages on the command line
485     * @return the includes table after setting the specified package
486     * names
487     */
488    ElementsTable packages(Collection<String> packageNames) {
489        packageNames.stream()
490            .map(ModulePackage::new)
491            .forEachOrdered(mpkg -> cmdLinePackages.add(mpkg));
492        return this;
493    }
494
495    /**
496     * Returns the aggregate set of included packages and specified
497     * subpackages.
498     *
499     * @return the aggregate set of included packages and specified
500     * subpackages
501     */
502    Iterable<ModulePackage> getPackagesToParse() throws IOException {
503        List<ModulePackage> result = new ArrayList<>();
504        result.addAll(cmdLinePackages);
505        result.addAll(subPackages);
506        return result;
507    }
508
509    private void computeSubpackages() throws ToolException {
510        options.excludes().stream()
511            .map(ModulePackage::new)
512            .forEachOrdered(mpkg -> excludePackages.add(mpkg));
513
514        excludePackages.forEach(p -> getEntry(p).excluded = true);
515
516        for (ModulePackage modpkg : subPackages) {
517            List<Location> locs = getLocation(modpkg);
518            for (Location loc : locs) {
519                addPackagesFromLocations(loc, modpkg);
520            }
521        }
522    }
523
524    /* Call fm.list and wrap any IOException that occurs in a ToolException */
525    private Iterable<JavaFileObject> fmList(Location location,
526            String packagename,
527            Set<JavaFileObject.Kind> kinds,
528            boolean recurse) throws ToolException {
529        try {
530            return fm.list(location, packagename, kinds, recurse);
531        } catch (IOException ioe) {
532            String text = log.getText("main.file.manager.list", packagename);
533            throw new ToolException(SYSERR, text, ioe);
534        }
535    }
536
537    private void addPackagesFromLocations(Location packageLocn,
538            ModulePackage modpkg) throws ToolException {
539        for (JavaFileObject fo : fmList(packageLocn, modpkg.packageName,
540            sourceKinds, true)) {
541            String binaryName = fm.inferBinaryName(packageLocn, fo);
542            String pn = getPackageName(binaryName);
543            String simpleName = getSimpleName(binaryName);
544            Entry e = getEntry(pn);
545            if (!e.isExcluded() && isValidClassName(simpleName)) {
546                ModuleSymbol msym = (modpkg.hasModule())
547                    ? syms.getModule(names.fromString(modpkg.moduleName))
548                    : findModuleOfPackageName(modpkg.packageName);
549
550                if (msym != null && !msym.isUnnamed()) {
551                    syms.enterPackage(msym, names.fromString(pn));
552                    ModulePackage npkg = new ModulePackage(msym.toString(), pn);
553                    cmdLinePackages.add(npkg);
554                } else {
555                    cmdLinePackages.add(e.modpkg);
556                }
557                e.files = (e.files == null
558                    ? com.sun.tools.javac.util.List.of(fo)
559                    : e.files.prepend(fo));
560            }
561        }
562    }
563
564    /**
565     * Returns the "requires" modules for the target module.
566     * @param mdle the target module element
567     * @param onlyTransitive true gets all the requires transitive, otherwise
568     *                 gets all the non-transitive requires
569     *
570     * @return a set of modules
571     */
572    private Set<ModuleElement> getModuleRequires(ModuleElement mdle,
573            boolean onlyTransitive) throws ToolException {
574        Set<ModuleElement> result = new HashSet<>();
575        for (RequiresDirective rd : ElementFilter
576            .requiresIn(mdle.getDirectives())) {
577            ModuleElement dep = rd.getDependency();
578            if (result.contains(dep))
579                continue;
580            if (!isMandated(mdle, rd) && onlyTransitive == rd.isTransitive()) {
581                if (!haveModuleSources(dep)) {
582                    if (!warnedNoSources.contains(dep)) {
583                        log.printWarningUsingKey(dep,
584                            "main.module_source_not_found",
585                            dep.getQualifiedName());
586                        warnedNoSources.add(dep);
587                    }
588                }
589                result.add(dep);
590            } else if (isMandated(mdle, rd) && haveModuleSources(dep)) {
591                result.add(dep);
592            }
593        }
594        return result;
595    }
596
597    private boolean isMandated(ModuleElement mdle, RequiresDirective rd) {
598        return toolEnv.elements.getOrigin(mdle, rd) == MANDATED;
599    }
600
601    Set<ModuleElement> warnedNoSources = new HashSet<>();
602
603    Map<ModuleSymbol, Boolean> haveModuleSourcesCache = new HashMap<>();
604
605    private boolean haveModuleSources(ModuleElement mdle) throws ToolException {
606        ModuleSymbol msym = (ModuleSymbol) mdle;
607        if (msym.sourceLocation != null) {
608            return true;
609        }
610        if (msym.patchLocation != null) {
611            Boolean value = haveModuleSourcesCache.get(msym);
612            if (value == null) {
613                value = fmList(msym.patchLocation, "", sourceKinds, true)
614                    .iterator().hasNext();
615                haveModuleSourcesCache.put(msym, value);
616            }
617            return value;
618        }
619        return false;
620    }
621
622    private void computeSpecifiedModules() throws ToolException {
623        if (expandRequires == null) { // no expansion requested
624            specifiedModuleElements
625                = Collections.unmodifiableSet(specifiedModuleElements);
626            return;
627        }
628
629        final boolean expandAll = expandRequires.equals(AccessKind.PRIVATE)
630            || expandRequires.equals(AccessKind.PACKAGE);
631
632        Set<ModuleElement> result = new LinkedHashSet<>();
633        ListBuffer<ModuleElement> queue = new ListBuffer<>();
634
635        // expand each specified module
636        for (ModuleElement mdle : specifiedModuleElements) {
637            result.add(mdle); // a specified module is included
638            queue.append(mdle);
639            Set<ModuleElement> publicRequires = getModuleRequires(mdle, true);
640            result.addAll(publicRequires);
641            // add all requires public
642            queue.addAll(publicRequires);
643
644            if (expandAll) {
645                // add non-public requires if needed
646                result.addAll(getModuleRequires(mdle, false));
647            }
648        }
649
650        // compute the transitive closure of all the requires public
651        for (ModuleElement m = queue.poll(); m != null; m = queue.poll()) {
652            for (ModuleElement mdle : getModuleRequires(m, true)) {
653                if (!result.contains(mdle)) {
654                    result.add(mdle);
655                    queue.append(mdle);
656                }
657            }
658        }
659        specifiedModuleElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(result);
660    }
661
662    private Set<PackageElement> getAllModulePackages(ModuleElement mdle)
663            throws ToolException {
664        Set<PackageElement> result = new HashSet<>();
665        ModuleSymbol msym = (ModuleSymbol) mdle;
666        List<Location> msymlocs
667            = getModuleLocation(locations, msym.name.toString());
668        for (Location msymloc : msymlocs) {
669            for (JavaFileObject fo : fmList(msymloc, "", sourceKinds, true)) {
670                if (fo.getName().endsWith("module-info.java")) {
671                    continue;
672                }
673                String binaryName = fm.inferBinaryName(msymloc, fo);
674                String pn = getPackageName(binaryName);
675                PackageSymbol psym
676                    = syms.enterPackage(msym, names.fromString(pn));
677                result.add(psym);
678            }
679        }
680        return result;
681    }
682
683    private Set<PackageElement> computeModulePackages() throws ToolException {
684        AccessKind accessValue
685            = accessFilter.getAccessValue(ElementKind.PACKAGE);
686        final boolean documentAllModulePackages
687            = (accessValue == AccessKind.PACKAGE ||
688                accessValue == AccessKind.PRIVATE);
689
690        accessValue = accessFilter.getAccessValue(ElementKind.MODULE);
691        final boolean moduleDetailedMode = (accessValue == AccessKind.PACKAGE ||
692            accessValue == AccessKind.PRIVATE);
693        Set<PackageElement> expandedModulePackages = new LinkedHashSet<>();
694
695        for (ModuleElement mdle : specifiedModuleElements) {
696            if (documentAllModulePackages) { // include all packages
697                List<PackageElement> packages
698                    = ElementFilter.packagesIn(mdle.getEnclosedElements());
699                expandedModulePackages.addAll(packages);
700                expandedModulePackages.addAll(getAllModulePackages(mdle));
701            } else { // selectively include required packages
702                List<ExportsDirective> exports
703                    = ElementFilter.exportsIn(mdle.getDirectives());
704                for (ExportsDirective export : exports) {
705                    // add if fully exported or add qualified exports only if
706                    // desired
707                    if (export.getTargetModules() == null
708                        || documentAllModulePackages || moduleDetailedMode) {
709                        expandedModulePackages.add(export.getPackage());
710                    }
711                }
712            }
713
714            // add all packages specified on the command line
715            // belonging to this module
716            if (!cmdLinePackages.isEmpty()) {
717                for (ModulePackage modpkg : cmdLinePackages) {
718                    PackageElement pkg
719                        = toolEnv.elements.getPackageElement(mdle,
720                            modpkg.packageName);
721                    if (pkg != null) {
722                        expandedModulePackages.add(pkg);
723                    }
724                }
725            }
726        }
727        return expandedModulePackages;
728    }
729
730    private void
731            initializeIncludedSets(Set<PackageElement> expandedModulePackages) {
732
733        // process modules
734        Set<ModuleElement> imodules = new LinkedHashSet<>();
735        // add all the expanded modules
736        imodules.addAll(specifiedModuleElements);
737
738        // process packages
739        Set<PackageElement> ipackages = new LinkedHashSet<>();
740        // add all packages belonging to expanded modules
741        ipackages.addAll(expandedModulePackages);
742        // add all specified packages
743        specifiedPackageElements.forEach(pkg -> {
744            ModuleElement mdle = toolEnv.elements.getModuleOf(pkg);
745            if (mdle != null)
746                imodules.add(mdle);
747            ipackages.add(pkg);
748        });
749
750        // process types
751        Set<TypeElement> iclasses = new LinkedHashSet<>();
752        // add all types enclosed in expanded modules and packages
753        ipackages.forEach(pkg -> addAllClasses(iclasses, pkg));
754        // add all types and its nested types
755        specifiedTypeElements.forEach(klass -> {
756            ModuleElement mdle = toolEnv.elements.getModuleOf(klass);
757            if (mdle != null && !mdle.isUnnamed())
758                imodules.add(mdle);
759            PackageElement pkg = toolEnv.elements.getPackageOf(klass);
760            ipackages.add(pkg);
761            addAllClasses(iclasses, klass, true);
762        });
763
764        // all done, freeze the collections
765        includedModuleElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(imodules);
766        includedPackageElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(ipackages);
767        includedTypeElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(iclasses);
768    }
769
770    /*
771     * Computes the included packages and freezes the specified packages list.
772     */
773    private void computeSpecifiedPackages() throws ToolException {
774
775        computeSubpackages();
776
777        Set<PackageElement> packlist = new LinkedHashSet<>();
778        cmdLinePackages.forEach(modpkg -> {
779            PackageElement pkg;
780            if (modpkg.hasModule()) {
781                ModuleElement mdle
782                    = toolEnv.elements.getModuleElement(modpkg.moduleName);
783                pkg = toolEnv.elements.getPackageElement(mdle,
784                    modpkg.packageName);
785            } else {
786                pkg = toolEnv.elements.getPackageElement(modpkg.toString());
787            }
788
789            if (pkg != null) {
790                packlist.add(pkg);
791            } else {
792                log.printWarningUsingKey("main.package_not_found",
793                    modpkg.toString());
794            }
795        });
796        specifiedPackageElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(packlist);
797    }
798
799    /**
800     * Adds all classes as well as inner classes, to the specified
801     * list.
802     */
803    private void computeSpecifiedTypes() throws ToolException {
804        Set<TypeElement> classes = new LinkedHashSet<>();
805        classDecList.forEach(def -> {
806            TypeElement te = def.sym;
807            if (te != null) {
808                addAllClasses(classes, te, true);
809            }
810        });
811        for (String className : classArgList) {
812            TypeElement te = toolEnv.loadClass(className);
813            if (te == null) {
814                String text = log.getText("javadoc.class_not_found", className);
815                throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
816            } else {
817                addAllClasses(classes, te, true);
818            }
819        }
820        specifiedTypeElements = Collections.unmodifiableSet(classes);
821    }
822
823    private void addFilesForParser(Collection<JavaFileObject> result,
824            Collection<ModulePackage> collection,
825            boolean recurse) throws ToolException {
826        for (ModulePackage modpkg : collection) {
827            toolEnv.printInfo("main.Loading_source_files_for_package",
828                modpkg.toString());
829            List<JavaFileObject> files = getFiles(modpkg, recurse);
830            if (files.isEmpty()) {
831                String text = log.getText("main.no_source_files_for_package",
832                    modpkg.toString());
833                throw new ToolException(CMDERR, text);
834            } else {
835                result.addAll(files);
836            }
837        }
838    }
839
840    /**
841     * Returns an aggregated list of java file objects from the items
842     * specified on the command line. The packages specified should not
843     * recurse, however subpackages should recurse into the subdirectories.
844     * @return a list of java file objects
845     * @throws IOException if an error occurs
846     */
847    List<JavaFileObject> getFilesToParse() throws ToolException {
848        List<JavaFileObject> result = new ArrayList<>();
849        addFilesForParser(result, cmdLinePackages, false);
850        addFilesForParser(result, subPackages, true);
851        return result;
852    }
853
854    /**
855     * Returns the set of source files for a package.
856     *
857     * @param modpkg the specified package
858     * @return the set of file objects for the specified package
859     * @throws ToolException if an error occurs while accessing the files
860     */
861    private List<JavaFileObject> getFiles(ModulePackage modpkg,
862            boolean recurse) throws ToolException {
863        Entry e = getEntry(modpkg);
864        // The files may have been found as a side effect of searching for
865        // subpackages
866        if (e.files != null) {
867            return e.files;
868        }
869
870        ListBuffer<JavaFileObject> lb = new ListBuffer<>();
871        List<Location> locs = getLocation(modpkg);
872        if (locs.isEmpty()) {
873            return List.of();
874        }
875        String pname = modpkg.packageName;
876        for (Location packageLocn : locs) {
877            for (JavaFileObject fo : fmList(packageLocn, pname, sourceKinds,
878                recurse)) {
879                String binaryName = fm.inferBinaryName(packageLocn, fo);
880                String simpleName = getSimpleName(binaryName);
881                if (isValidClassName(simpleName)) {
882                    lb.append(fo);
883                }
884            }
885        }
886        return lb.toList();
887    }
888
889    private ModuleSymbol findModuleOfPackageName(String packageName) {
890        Name pack = names.fromString(packageName);
891        for (ModuleSymbol msym : modules.allModules()) {
892            PackageSymbol p = syms.getPackage(msym, pack);
893            if (p != null && !p.members().isEmpty()) {
894                return msym;
895            }
896        }
897        return null;
898    }
899
900    private List<Location> getLocation(ModulePackage modpkg)
901            throws ToolException {
902        if (locations.size() == 1
903            && !locations.contains(StandardLocation.MODULE_SOURCE_PATH)) {
904            return List.of(locations.get(0));
905        }
906
907        if (modpkg.hasModule()) {
908            return getModuleLocation(locations, modpkg.moduleName);
909        }
910        // TODO: handle invalid results better.
911        ModuleSymbol msym = findModuleOfPackageName(modpkg.packageName);
912        if (msym == null) {
913            return List.of();
914        }
915        return getModuleLocation(locations, msym.name.toString());
916    }
917
918    boolean haveSourceLocationWithModule = false;
919
920    private List<Location> getModuleLocation(List<Location> locations,
921            String msymName) throws ToolException {
922        List<Location> out = new ArrayList<>();
923        // search in the patch module first, this overrides others
924        if (locations.contains(StandardLocation.PATCH_MODULE_PATH)) {
925            Location loc = getModuleLocation(StandardLocation.PATCH_MODULE_PATH,
926                msymName);
927            if (loc != null)
928                out.add(loc);
929        }
930        for (Location location : locations) {
931            // skip patch module, already done
932            if (location == StandardLocation.PATCH_MODULE_PATH) {
933                continue;
934            } else if (location == StandardLocation.MODULE_SOURCE_PATH) {
935                Location loc = getModuleLocation(location, msymName);
936                if (loc != null)
937                    out.add(loc);
938            } else if (location == StandardLocation.SOURCE_PATH) {
939                haveSourceLocationWithModule = true;
940                out.add(StandardLocation.SOURCE_PATH);
941            }
942        }
943        return out;
944    }
945
946    private Location getModuleLocation(Location location, String msymName)
947            throws ToolException {
948        try {
949            return fm.getLocationForModule(location, msymName);
950        } catch (IOException ioe) {
951            String text
952                = log.getText("main.doclet_could_not_get_location", msymName);
953            throw new ToolException(ERROR, text, ioe);
954        }
955    }
956
957    private Entry getEntry(String name) {
958        return getEntry(new ModulePackage(name));
959    }
960
961    private Entry getEntry(ModulePackage modpkg) {
962        Entry e = entries.get(modpkg.packageName);
963        if (e == null) {
964            entries.put(modpkg.packageName, e = new Entry(modpkg));
965        }
966        return e;
967    }
968
969    private String getPackageName(String name) {
970        int lastDot = name.lastIndexOf(".");
971        return (lastDot == -1 ? "" : name.substring(0, lastDot));
972    }
973
974    private String getSimpleName(String name) {
975        int lastDot = name.lastIndexOf(".");
976        return (lastDot == -1 ? name : name.substring(lastDot + 1));
977    }
978
979    /**
980     * Adds all inner classes of this class, and their inner classes recursively, to the list
981     */
982    private void addAllClasses(Collection<TypeElement> list,
983            TypeElement typeElement, boolean filtered) {
984        ClassSymbol klass = (ClassSymbol) typeElement;
985        try {
986            // eliminate needless checking, do this first.
987            if (list.contains(klass))
988                return;
989            // ignore classes with invalid Java class names
990            if (!JavadocTool.isValidClassName(klass.name.toString()))
991                return;
992            if (filtered && !isTypeElementSelected(klass))
993                return;
994            list.add(klass);
995            for (Symbol sym : klass.members().getSymbols(NON_RECURSIVE)) {
996                if (sym != null && sym.kind == Kind.TYP) {
997                    ClassSymbol s = (ClassSymbol) sym;
998                    addAllClasses(list, s, filtered);
999                }
1000            }
1001        } catch (CompletionFailure e) {
1002            if (e.getMessage() != null)
1003                log.printWarning(e.getMessage());
1004            else
1005                log.printWarningUsingKey("main.unexpected.exception", e);
1006        }
1007    }
1008
1009    /**
1010     * Returns a list of all classes contained in this package, including
1011     * member classes of those classes, and their member classes, etc.
1012     */
1013    private void addAllClasses(Collection<TypeElement> list,
1014            PackageElement pkg) {
1015        boolean filtered = true;
1016        for (Element isym : pkg.getEnclosedElements()) {
1017            addAllClasses(list, (TypeElement) isym, filtered);
1018        }
1019    }
1020
1021    private boolean isTypeElementSelected(TypeElement te) {
1022        return (xclasses || toolEnv.getFileKind(te) == SOURCE)
1023            && isSelected(te);
1024    }
1025
1026    SimpleElementVisitor14<Boolean, Void> visibleElementVisitor = null;
1027
1028    /**
1029     * Returns true if the element is selected, by applying
1030     * the access filter checks. Special treatment is applied to
1031     * types, for a top level type the access filter applies completely,
1032     * however if is a nested type then it is allowed either  if
1033     * the enclosing is a static or the enclosing is also selected.
1034     *
1035     * @param e the element to be checked
1036     * @return true if the element is visible
1037     */
1038    public boolean isSelected(Element e) {
1039        if (toolEnv.isSynthetic((Symbol) e) && !toolEnv.isUnnamed((Symbol) e)) {
1040            return false;
1041        }
1042        if (visibleElementVisitor == null) {
1043            visibleElementVisitor = new SimpleElementVisitor14<>() {
1044                @Override
1045                public Boolean visitType(TypeElement e, Void p) {
1046                    if (!accessFilter.checkModifier(e)) {
1047                        return false; // it is not allowed
1048                    }
1049                    Element encl = e.getEnclosingElement();
1050
1051                    // check if nested
1052                    if (encl.getKind() == ElementKind.PACKAGE)
1053                        return true; // top-level class, allow it
1054
1055                    // is enclosed static
1056                    if (encl.getModifiers().contains(Modifier.STATIC))
1057                        return true; // allowed
1058
1059                    // check the enclosing
1060                    return visit(encl);
1061                }
1062
1063                @Override
1064                protected Boolean defaultAction(Element e, Void p) {
1065                    return accessFilter.checkModifier(e);
1066                }
1067
1068                @Override
1069                public Boolean visitUnknown(Element e, Void p) {
1070                    throw new AssertionError("unknown element: " + e);
1071                }
1072            };
1073        }
1074        return visibleElementVisitor.visit(e);
1075    }
1076
1077    private class IncludedVisitor
1078            extends SimpleElementVisitor14<Boolean, Void> {
1079        private final Set<Element> includedCache;
1080
1081        public IncludedVisitor() {
1082            includedCache = new LinkedHashSet<>();
1083        }
1084
1085        @Override
1086        public Boolean visitModule(ModuleElement e, Void p) {
1087            // deduced by specified and/or requires expansion
1088            return includedModuleElements.contains(e);
1089        }
1090
1091        @Override
1092        public Boolean visitPackage(PackageElement e, Void p) {
1093            // deduced by specified or downward expansions
1094            return includedPackageElements.contains(e);
1095        }
1096
1097        @Override
1098        public Boolean visitType(TypeElement e, Void p) {
1099            if (includedTypeElements.contains(e)) {
1100                return true;
1101            }
1102            if (isTypeElementSelected(e)) {
1103                // Class is nameable from top-level and
1104                // the class and all enclosing classes
1105                // pass the modifier filter.
1106                PackageElement pkg = toolEnv.elements.getPackageOf(e);
1107                if (specifiedPackageElements.contains(pkg)) {
1108                    return true;
1109                }
1110                Element enclosing = e.getEnclosingElement();
1111                if (enclosing != null) {
1112                    return switch (enclosing.getKind()) {
1113                    case CLASS, ENUM, RECORD, INTERFACE, ANNOTATION_TYPE -> visit(
1114                        enclosing);
1115                    case PACKAGE -> specifiedPackageElements
1116                        .contains((PackageElement) enclosing);
1117                    default -> throw new AssertionError(
1118                        "unknown element: " + enclosing);
1119                    };
1120                }
1121            }
1122            return false;
1123        }
1124
1125        // members
1126        @Override
1127        public Boolean defaultAction(Element e, Void p) {
1128            if (includedCache.contains(e))
1129                return true;
1130            if (visit(e.getEnclosingElement()) && isSelected(e)) {
1131                switch (e.getKind()) {
1132                case CLASS, ENUM, RECORD, INTERFACE, ANNOTATION_TYPE, MODULE, OTHER, PACKAGE -> throw new AssertionError(
1133                    "invalid element for this operation: " + e);
1134                default -> {
1135                    // the only allowed kinds in the cache are "members"
1136                    includedCache.add(e);
1137                    return true;
1138                }
1139                }
1140            }
1141            return false;
1142        }
1143
1144        @Override
1145        public Boolean visitUnknown(Element e, Void p) {
1146            throw new AssertionError("unknown element: " + e);
1147        }
1148
1149    }
1150
1151    class Entry {
1152        final ModulePackage modpkg;
1153        Boolean excluded = false;
1154        com.sun.tools.javac.util.List<JavaFileObject> files;
1155
1156        Entry(ModulePackage modpkg) {
1157            this.modpkg = modpkg;
1158        }
1159
1160        Entry(String name) {
1161            modpkg = new ModulePackage(name);
1162        }
1163
1164        boolean isExcluded() {
1165            return excluded;
1166        }
1167
1168        @Override
1169        public String toString() {
1170            return "Entry{" + "modpkg=" + modpkg + ", excluded=" + excluded
1171                + ", files=" + files + '}';
1172        }
1173    }
1174
1175    /**
1176     * A container class to retrieve the module and package pair
1177     * from a parsed qualified package name.
1178     */
1179    static class ModulePackage {
1180
1181        public final String moduleName;
1182        public final String packageName;
1183
1184        ModulePackage(String modulename, String packagename) {
1185            this.moduleName = modulename;
1186            this.packageName = packagename;
1187        }
1188
1189        ModulePackage(ModuleElement msym, String packagename) {
1190            this.moduleName = msym.toString();
1191            this.packageName = packagename;
1192        }
1193
1194        ModulePackage(String name) {
1195            String a[] = name.split("/");
1196            if (a.length == 2) {
1197                this.moduleName = a[0];
1198                this.packageName = a[1];
1199            } else {
1200                moduleName = null;
1201                packageName = name;
1202            }
1203        }
1204
1205        boolean hasModule() {
1206            return this.moduleName != null;
1207        }
1208
1209        @Override
1210        public boolean equals(Object obj) {
1211            if (obj instanceof ModulePackage that) {
1212                return this.toString().equals(that.toString());
1213            }
1214            return false;
1215        }
1216
1217        @Override
1218        public int hashCode() {
1219            return toString().hashCode();
1220        }
1221
1222        @Override
1223        public String toString() {
1224            return moduleName == null ? packageName
1225                : moduleName + "/" + packageName;
1226        }
1227    }
1228
1229    /**
1230     * A class which filters the access flags on classes, fields, methods, etc.
1231     *
1232     * @see javax.lang.model.element.Modifier
1233     */
1234
1235    static class ModifierFilter {
1236        /**
1237         * The allowed ElementKind that can be stored.
1238         */
1239        static final EnumSet<ElementKind> ALLOWED_KINDS
1240            = EnumSet.of(ElementKind.METHOD,
1241                ElementKind.CLASS,
1242                ElementKind.PACKAGE,
1243                ElementKind.MODULE);
1244
1245        // all possible access levels allowed for each element
1246        private final EnumMap<ElementKind, EnumSet<AccessKind>> filterMap
1247            = new EnumMap<>(ElementKind.class);
1248
1249        // the specified access level for each element
1250        private final EnumMap<ElementKind, AccessKind> accessMap
1251            = new EnumMap<>(ElementKind.class);
1252
1253        /**
1254         * Constructor - Specify a filter.
1255         *
1256         * @param options the tool options
1257         */
1258        ModifierFilter(ToolOptions options) {
1259
1260            AccessKind accessValue = null;
1261            for (ElementKind kind : ALLOWED_KINDS) {
1262                accessValue = switch (kind) {
1263                case METHOD -> options.showMembersAccess();
1264                case CLASS -> options.showTypesAccess();
1265                case PACKAGE -> options.showPackagesAccess();
1266                case MODULE -> options.showModuleContents();
1267                default -> throw new AssertionError("unknown element: " + kind);
1268                };
1269                accessMap.put(kind, accessValue);
1270                filterMap.put(kind, getFilterSet(accessValue));
1271            }
1272        }
1273
1274        static EnumSet<AccessKind> getFilterSet(AccessKind accessValue) {
1275            return switch (accessValue) {
1276            case PUBLIC -> EnumSet.of(AccessKind.PUBLIC);
1277            case PROTECTED -> EnumSet.of(AccessKind.PUBLIC,
1278                AccessKind.PROTECTED);
1279            case PACKAGE -> EnumSet.of(AccessKind.PUBLIC, AccessKind.PROTECTED,
1280                AccessKind.PACKAGE);
1281            case PRIVATE -> EnumSet.allOf(AccessKind.class);
1282            };
1283        }
1284
1285        public AccessKind getAccessValue(ElementKind kind) {
1286            if (!ALLOWED_KINDS.contains(kind)) {
1287                throw new IllegalArgumentException("not allowed: " + kind);
1288            }
1289            return accessMap.getOrDefault(kind, AccessKind.PROTECTED);
1290        }
1291
1292        /**
1293         * Returns true if access is allowed.
1294         *
1295         * @param e the element in question
1296         * @return whether the modifiers pass this filter
1297         */
1298        public boolean checkModifier(Element e) {
1299            Set<Modifier> modifiers = e.getModifiers();
1300            AccessKind fflag = AccessKind.PACKAGE;
1301            if (modifiers.contains(Modifier.PUBLIC)) {
1302                fflag = AccessKind.PUBLIC;
1303            } else if (modifiers.contains(Modifier.PROTECTED)) {
1304                fflag = AccessKind.PROTECTED;
1305            } else if (modifiers.contains(Modifier.PRIVATE)) {
1306                fflag = AccessKind.PRIVATE;
1307            }
1308            EnumSet<AccessKind> filterSet
1309                = filterMap.get(getAllowedKind(e.getKind()));
1310            return filterSet.contains(fflag);
1311        }
1312
1313        // convert a requested element kind to an allowed access kind
1314        private ElementKind getAllowedKind(ElementKind kind) {
1315            return switch (kind) {
1316            case CLASS, METHOD, MODULE, PACKAGE -> kind;
1317            case RECORD, ANNOTATION_TYPE, ENUM, INTERFACE -> ElementKind.CLASS;
1318            case CONSTRUCTOR, ENUM_CONSTANT, EXCEPTION_PARAMETER, FIELD, INSTANCE_INIT, LOCAL_VARIABLE, PARAMETER, RESOURCE_VARIABLE, STATIC_INIT, TYPE_PARAMETER, RECORD_COMPONENT -> ElementKind.METHOD;
1319            default -> throw new AssertionError("unsupported kind: " + kind);
1320            };
1321        }
1322    } // end ModifierFilter
1323}
